title: League of Legends [ More Female Champs ]
body:
I don't know if it is just me that is complaining, But as I have seen it the past 3 champs have indeed been all males. 

I do realize 90% of LoL's Community are males. But the female gender is definitely being underrepresented in my opinion.

I'd like to check the League Site, find a _new_ release for a _new_ champion that is indeed, not a male. 

A small request, for a small percentage of people may agree but to me this is a major thing in League of Legends, whether in the future this is a good thing or a bad thing.

Summoners. Do you Agree? or Disagree? Reasons?

I hope this is taken into Consideration, Riot.

{{summoner:14}}  - Tera 

[ Kindred, Not Included ]

replies.body:
Here I will only list champs who are strictly human because let's be honest, no one really cares if a humanoid or monster is male or female, in fact, I don't think people actually care about whether a human champ is male or female either but w/e. 

For the sake of argument:

Human male champs.

____________
___________
______________

A bit less? Yeah.

Underrepresented? No.

Can we get more girls? Welcome.

Does it HAVE to get 50-50? No.
think you need to reevaluate your definition of equality, classic example of a big headed female who gives ACTUAL feminists a bad name, nothing in this life is cut down the middle

Well said.

Hearing crap in politics like defining "mansplaining" unfortunately gets the people pushing for real equality lumped in with the self-obsessed morons.

It might have been a *little* harsh on the OP though, before doing a count like Kagami I thought it was more heavily weighted too.

Underrepresented? UNDERREPRESENTED? WTF. DOES IT HAVE TO BE AN EQUAL 50% 50% EQUATION?! Jesus don't start that bullcrap. They already got rid of Graves cigar.... Next they'll make sure there's only aliens and monsters to be politically correct because humans are racist, offensive and sexist. They'll call Lucian a robot because if they called him a black male it'd be racist. My advice: play the dam game and don't bring real life feminism bullschneider into a game. I'm into being fair but I don't think there's enough evidence to support your cause.. Riot have made a game. They haven't made an influential race/sex orientated game. They're making characters. Rek'sai is a female. Kalista is a female. They are pretty recent champs. Riot brings around 5 new champs a year..

There's a champ called "Vi." Gotta be the biggest bad ass in the game. She is a white female with pink hair. 

Just don't.. I'm not angry or offended.. Just shocked that someone would bring this argument into a game like this. It'd be fair enough if the champs were 80% male.
You're reaching pretty fucking far dude rofl you needa chill
Yeah I did take it pretty far, don't take my words to heart but I don't think it is relevant in League aswell as most games.
You sexist ba*****, no one wants your kind here making this community a crap place. Yes, this community isn't great but when we remove/silence your kind it should be a slightly better place

Bro what made you think Kayle and Morg were genderless? XD
They're sisters and quite obviously female (Have you SEEN Morgana's splash art/breasts?) lol
It says in the lore that they are sisters if you want evidence.

Yeah that's exactly right :)
I remember reading about it a while ago cause Morgs my main sup so I read about her

Why has this been down voted? This is a fair topic, it's not excessively sexist but a lot of the champions are male.

Comments?
It's nice to see other's different point of views. I wanted to bring this into awareness and am ready to take in any rude remarks about this topic.
Hahaha and now my honest curiosity has been down voted.
Isn't Kindred have female?
Eh, Lambs Female - Wolf is Male.

I do realize 90% of LoL's Community are males.

If this meant anything at all, then there would be more female champions than males, due to Riot trying to cater to horny teenage boys.
Kindred is essentially a female. Do gender really mean that much? If you're a feminist then I'm wasting my time, obviously.
